name: Advent of Code 2023
desc: Wanted to brush up on my algo skills and try out functional programming. I was recommended Elixir. This year had some incredibly difficult problems compared to 2019 and 2020.

name: NUSWhispers Analysis
desc: A website displaying stats and data analysis on NUSWhispers' confessions inspired by [this post](https://www.facebook.com/nuswhispers/photos/a.817681254969004/3204771462926626). This project has custom facebook posts scraper, timeseries charts, TF-IDF wordclouds, mention graphs, several custom UI components. The initial version was my submission for Hack&Roll 2021. I learnt a lot from this project.

name: Advent of Code 2020
desc: Found it fun last year, so I did it again this year, this time with Rust. I documented on some of the notable problems and my experience with Rust in the repo.

name: Hole in the Wall game
desc: A browser game reminiscent of Hole in the Wall gameshow powered by Tensorflow Pose Estimation library (aka Posenet)

name: Advent of Code 2019
tech: Just python but involves some algorithmic problem solving, check out the repo for details
desc: Advent of Code is a yearly coding challenge with daily coding problems for the month of December. I completed the Advent of Code 2019 challenge, finishing it right on New Year's Eve. I took the chance to learn a new language like many others which is python in my case.

name: Luminus Filetree
desc: Browser extension for providing a filetree UI option in Luminus Files view.

name: This website/blog
desc: Personal blog and portfolio website powered by Jekyll.

name: Kattis Graph
usage: once refined, hopefully used by students doing CS3233 Competitive Programming
desc: Website to chart out stats I scraped daily from Kattis

name: NUS modules dependency visualizer
desc: Visualizes NUS modules dependencies for each course. Hack&Roll 2019 submission.

name: Raspberry Pi for h265 decoding on TV
usage: daily whenever I'm back at home
desc: Raspberry Pi running OSMC media center for playing h265 encoded videos. There wasn't any coding involved, but I had to do some research to find OSMC as there was little to no support for h265 videos on the Pi.

name: Download Scheduler
desc: What intended to be a website for letting my phone do overnight downloads (because midnight quota is cheaper in Indonesia), has now become a website gathering download links to my selected animes and youtube channels

name: Bus Arrivals
desc: Gathers and displays bus arrival timings for routes I configured for public and NUS buses. I use this daily to plan my path to and from school.

name: Video Auto Caption
desc: Generates captions for videos. Hack&Roll 2018 submission.
